young_adults.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
young_adults.description: Harry Potter, an eleven-year-old orphan, discovers that he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

young_adults.title: The Hunger Games
young_adults.description: In a post-apocalyptic world, teenager Katniss Everdeen volunteers to take her sister's place in a televised fight to the death.

young_adults.title: Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief
young_adults.description: Percy Jackson discovers he is a demigod and embarks on a quest to prevent a war among the gods.

young_adults.title: Divergent
young_adults.description: In a society divided into factions based on virtues, Tris Prior discovers she is Divergent and uncovers a conspiracy to destroy all Divergents.

young_adults.title: The Maze Runner
young_adults.description: Thomas wakes up in a maze with no memory of his past, joining other boys who are trying to find a way out.

young_adults.title: The Fault in Our Stars
young_adults.description: Two teenagers, Hazel and Gus, both have cancer and meet at a support group, forming a deep bond as they deal with their illness.

young_adults.title: To All the Boys I've Loved Before
young_adults.description: Lara Jean's secret love letters are exposed, leading to complicated relationships and unexpected romance.

young_adults.title: Thirteen Reasons Why
young_adults.description: Clay Jensen receives a box of cassette tapes recorded by Hannah Baker, his classmate and crush, who committed suicide, explaining the reasons for her actions.

young_adults.title: Eleanor & Park
young_adults.description: Two misfit high-schoolers, Eleanor and Park, fall in love over their shared love of music and comics.

young_adults.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
young_adults.description: Jacob discovers an orphanage run by Miss Peregrine and filled with children with unique abilities, uncovering a hidden world.

young_adults.title: The Book Thief
young_adults.description: In Nazi Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others, while her family hides a Jewish fighter in their home.

young_adults.title: Looking for Alaska
young_adults.description: Miles Halter enrolls in boarding school, seeking a Great Perhaps and forms a close bond with Alaska Young, leading to a life-changing journey.

graphic_novels.title: Maus
graphic_novels.description: A graphic novel depicting the experiences of a Holocaust survivor and his son.

graphic_novels.title: Watchmen
graphic_novels.description: A dark and complex story about flawed superheroes in an alternate history.

graphic_novels.title: Persepolis
graphic_novels.description: An autobiographical graphic novel about a girl's childhood in Iran during and after the Islamic Revolution.

graphic_novels.title: Saga
graphic_novels.description: An epic space opera/fantasy comic book series about a family from different worlds fighting to survive.

graphic_novels.title: Sandman
graphic_novels.description: A comic book series about Dream of the Endless, who rules over the world of dreams.

graphic_novels.title: V for Vendetta
graphic_novels.description: A dystopian political thriller about a masked vigilante's fight against a totalitarian regime.

graphic_novels.title: Blankets
graphic_novels.description: An autobiographical graphic novel about the author's childhood and first love.

graphic_novels.title: Bone
graphic_novels.description: A comic book series following the adventures of the Bone cousins in a fantasy world.

graphic_novels.title: Y: The Last Man
graphic_novels.description: A post-apocalyptic science fiction comic book series about the last man on Earth.

graphic_novels.title: Fun Home
graphic_novels.description: A graphic memoir exploring the author's relationship with her father.

graphic_novels.title: The Walking Dead
graphic_novels.description: A comic book series following survivors of a zombie apocalypse.

graphic_novels.title: Locke & Key
graphic_novels.description: A comic book series about a family and their ancestral home filled with magical keys.

graphic_novels.title: Ms. Marvel
graphic_novels.description: A superhero comic book series about Kamala Khan, a teenager who becomes the new Ms. Marvel.

graphic_novels.title: Nimona
graphic_novels.description: A fantasy graphic novel about a shapeshifter named Nimona and her supervillain boss.

graphic_novels.title: Scott Pilgrim
graphic_novels.description: A series of graphic novels about Scott Pilgrim, a young slacker who must battle his girlfriend's seven evil exes.

graphic_novels.title: Saga of the Swamp Thing
graphic_novels.description: A comic book series about a plant-based creature known as the Swamp Thing.

graphic_novels.title: Ghost World
graphic_novels.description: A graphic novel about the lives of two teenage girls as they transition from high school to adulthood.

graphic_novels.title: The Sandman: Overture
graphic_novels.description: A prequel to the original Sandman series, exploring the origins of Dream.

graphic_novels.title: American Born Chinese
graphic_novels.description: A graphic novel that weaves together three stories about the Asian-American experience.

graphic_novels.title: Fables
graphic_novels.description: A comic book series about fairy tale characters living in exile in modern-day New York City.

non_fiction.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
non_fiction.description: A book that explores the history of our species from the Stone Age to the present.

non_fiction.title: Educated
non_fiction.description: A memoir by Tara Westover detailing her life growing up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho.

non_fiction.title: Becoming
non_fiction.description: Michelle Obama's memoir, chronicling her life from childhood to her years as First Lady of the United States.

non_fiction.title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
non_fiction.description: The story of Henrietta Lacks and the immortal cell line, HeLa, that came from her cancer cells in 1951.

non_fiction.title: The Power of Habit
non_fiction.description: A book that explores the science behind why habits exist and how they can be changed.

non_fiction.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
non_fiction.description: Daniel Kahneman's book that delves into the two systems that drive the way we think.

non_fiction.title: The Wright Brothers
non_fiction.description: The story of the Wright brothers and their journey to invent the airplane.

non_fiction.title: Unbroken
non_fiction.description: A World War II story of survival, resilience, and redemption.

non_fiction.title: Grit
non_fiction.description: Angela Duckworth's book that reveals the power of passion and perseverance.

non_fiction.title: Quiet
non_fiction.description: Susan Cain's exploration of the power of introverts in a world that can't stop talking.

non_fiction.title: The Glass Castle
non_fiction.description: Jeannette Walls' memoir of growing up in a dysfunctional and nomadic family.

non_fiction.title: Born a Crime
non_fiction.description: Trevor Noah's account of growing up in apartheid-era South Africa.

non_fiction.title: Bad Blood
non_fiction.description: The story of the rise and fall of Theranos and its founder, Elizabeth Holmes.

non_fiction.title: The Sixth Extinction
non_fiction.description: An exploration of the ongoing sixth mass extinction caused by human activity.

non_fiction.title: Why We Sleep
non_fiction.description: A book that delves into the importance of sleep and how it affects our health.

non_fiction.title: When Breath Becomes Air
non_fiction.description: Paul Kalanithi's memoir about facing his own mortality.

non_fiction.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
non_fiction.description: Mark Manson's counterintuitive approach to living a good life.

non_fiction.title: Factfulness
non_fiction.description: Hans Rosling's book about the ten reasons we're wrong about the world.

non_fiction.title: The Body
non_fiction.description: Bill Bryson's exploration of the human body and its functions.

non_fiction.title: Atomic Habits
non_fiction.description: James Clear's guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones.

large_print.title: The Book Thief
large_print.description: A story about a young girl living in Nazi Germany who finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others.

large_print.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
large_print.description: A novel set in the American South during the 1930s, focusing on themes of racial injustice and moral growth.

large_print.title: The Nightingale
large_print.description: The story of two sisters in Nazi-occupied France and their struggle to survive and resist during World War II.

large_print.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
large_print.description: A young girl growing up in the swamps of North Carolina becomes a suspect in a murder case.

large_print.title: The Silent Patient
large_print.description: A woman who shoots her husband and then stops speaking is treated by a psychotherapist determined to uncover the truth.

large_print.title: The Great Gatsby
large_print.description: A novel about the American dream and the excesses of the Jazz Age, told through the eyes of Nick Carraway.

large_print.title: The Girl on the Train
large_print.description: A psychological thriller about a woman who believes she has witnessed a crime from her train window.

large_print.title: Big Little Lies
large_print.description: A novel that follows three women whose seemingly perfect lives unravel to the point of murder.

large_print.title: The Alchemist
large_print.description: A philosophical novel about a young shepherd on a journey to find treasure, learning life's lessons along the way.

large_print.title: The Light Between Oceans
large_print.description: A lighthouse keeper and his wife find a baby adrift at sea and decide to raise her, with devastating consequences.

large_print.title: The Help
large_print.description: A novel about African American maids working in white households in Jackson, Mississippi, during the 1960s.

large_print.title: The Outsider
large_print.description: A thriller by Stephen King about a seemingly straightforward murder investigation that becomes increasingly complex.

large_print.title: Little Fires Everywhere
large_print.description: A novel about two families in suburban Ohio whose lives are upended by a custody battle over a Chinese-American baby.

large_print.title: A Man Called Ove
large_print.description: A heartwarming tale about a grumpy yet lovable man whose life is changed when a new family moves in next door.

large_print.title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
large_print.description: A novel about a socially awkward woman whose carefully ordered life changes when she meets a bumbling IT guy from her office.

large_print.title: The Catcher in the Rye
large_print.description: A story about teenage rebellion and alienation, told through the eyes of Holden Caulfield.

large_print.title: The Road
large_print.description: A bleak, harrowing tale of a father and son journeying through a post-apocalyptic America.

large_print.title: All the Light We Cannot See
large_print.description: The intertwined stories of a blind French girl and a German boy during World War II.

large_print.title: The Goldfinch
large_print.description: A young boy in New York City miraculously survives an accident that takes his mother's life.

large_print.title: The Handmaid's Tale
large_print.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where women are property of the state.
